actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Actor for 'Judgment at Nuremberg' (1961). He was also a successful director, with his film 'The Pedestrian' nominated for Best Foreign Language Film. He was the younger brother of actress Maria Schell.

filmography.title: Judgment at Nuremberg
filmography.role_description: The brilliant defense attorney representing the German judges accused of war crimes, who argues that they were merely following the law.
filmography.plot: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazis for war crimes.

filmography.title: The Man in the Glass Booth
filmography.role_description: A wealthy Jewish industrialist who is kidnapped and put on trial in Israel, accused of being a Nazi war criminal.
filmography.plot: A Jewish businessman is kidnapped to Israel for trial as a Nazi war criminal, but his identity and guilt are called into question.

filmography.title: Julia
filmography.role_description: An anti-fascist operative who helps the protagonist Lillian Hellman smuggle money into Nazi Germany.
filmography.plot: At the behest of an old friend, playwright Lillian Hellman undertakes a dangerous mission to smuggle funds into Nazi Germany.

filmography.title: Topkapi
filmography.role_description: The suave mastermind behind a complex heist to steal a jeweled dagger from the Topkapi Palace museum.
filmography.plot: A conman gets mixed up with a group of thieves who plan to rob the Topkapi Palace in Istanbul.

filmography.title: The Black Hole
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but mad scientist who plans to fly his massive spaceship straight into a black hole.
filmography.plot: A research vessel finds a missing ship, commanded by a mysterious scientist, hovering on the edge of a black hole.

filmography.title: A Bridge Too Far
filmography.role_description: The commander of the II SS Panzer Corps who organizes the German defense against the Allied Operation Market Garden.
filmography.plot: Allied forces attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands in the hope of breaking the German lines.

filmography.title: Cross of Iron
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic Prussian officer obsessed with winning the Iron Cross, leading to conflict with his battle-hardened sergeant.
filmography.plot: A German commander and his sergeant clash on the Russian front during World War II.

filmography.title: Deep Impact
filmography.role_description: The estranged father of Tea Leoni's character, with whom she reconciles as a comet threatens Earth.
filmography.plot: Unless a comet can be destroyed before colliding with Earth, only those allowed into shelters will survive.

filmography.title: The Young Lions
filmography.role_description: A cynical German officer who commands Marlon Brando's character.
filmography.plot: The destiny of three soldiers during World War II: a German officer, and two Americans.

filmography.title: The Odessa File
filmography.role_description: The 'Butcher of Riga', a former SS officer hiding in modern Germany whom a journalist is tracking.
filmography.plot: Following the suicide of an elderly Jewish man, a journalist investigates the man's former concentration camp commander.

filmography.title: Stalin
filmography.role_description: The leader of the Bolshevik Revolution whose health declines as Stalin rises to power.
filmography.plot: A bio-pic of Joseph Stalin, showing his rise to power and his brutal reign as leader of the Soviet Union.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor in a Series, Miniseries or TV Movie

filmography.title: Little Odessa
filmography.role_description: The estranged father of a hitman who returns to his Russian-Jewish neighborhood in Brooklyn.
filmography.plot: A hit man for the Russian Jewish mob returns to his home in the Brighton Beach area of Brooklyn to perform a hit.

filmography.title: The Pedestrian
filmography.role_description: A wealthy industrialist whose Nazi past is exposed by a journalist. Schell also directed this film.
filmography.plot: A German industrialist is haunted by his war crimes when a reporter begins digging into his past.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Foreign-Language Foreign Film

filmography.title: Peter the Great
filmography.role_description: Schell plays the older version of the Russian Tsar in this lavish miniseries.
filmography.plot: The life of Peter I of Russia, also known as Peter the Great.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Miniseries or Motion Picture Made for Television

filmography.title: The Chosen
filmography.role_description: A Zionist scholar and father who clashes with a Hasidic rabbi over the creation of Israel.
filmography.plot: In 1940s Brooklyn, two Jewish boys from very different backgrounds become friends, despite the ideological conflict between their fathers.

filmography.title: The Freshman
filmography.role_description: An eccentric chef with a bizarre specialty menu in this comedy starring Marlon Brando.
filmography.plot: A film student in New York City gets involved with a mobster who resembles a certain cinematic godfather.

filmography.title: Vampires
filmography.role_description: A corrupt Cardinal who makes a deal with a master vampire to gain immortality.
filmography.plot: A vampire hunter and his team hunt down the master vampire Valek, who is seeking an ancient relic.

filmography.title: Telling Lies in America
filmography.role_description: The immigrant father of the protagonist who struggles to adapt to life in America.
filmography.plot: A Hungarian immigrant boy coming of age in 1960s America tries to find his place in the world.

filmography.title: The Reluctant Saint
filmography.role_description: A simple-minded young man who becomes a priest and eventually a saint (Joseph of Cupertino).
filmography.plot: The life story of Joseph of Cupertino, a slow-witted 17th-century Italian peasant who became a mystic and a saint.

filmography.title: Five Finger Exercise
filmography.role_description: A young German tutor whose presence disrupts the dynamics of a wealthy American family.
filmography.plot: A young German tutor is hired by a wealthy family in California, but his arrival causes tension and reveals hidden secrets.

filmography.title: The Castle
filmography.role_description: The land surveyor who tries to gain access to the mysterious authorities of a castle.
filmography.plot: A man known only as K. arrives in a village governed by a mysterious castle, but is unable to gain entrance or meet the officials.

filmography.title: Return of the Dancing Master
filmography.role_description: A wealthy businessman with a hidden past in this Swedish thriller.
filmography.plot: A retired police officer investigates a brutal murder in a remote village, uncovering a neo-Nazi conspiracy.

filmography.title: Counterpoint
filmography.role_description: A German general and music lover who forces a captured American orchestra to perform for him.
filmography.plot: During WWII, a famous American conductor and his symphony orchestra are captured by German troops and forced to play concerts.

filmography.title: Krakatoa, East of Java
filmography.role_description: The captain of a ship on a dangerous mission to find sunken treasure near an erupting volcano.
filmography.plot: A ship captain leads a group of divers and treasure hunters to retrieve a fortune in pearls from a shipwreck near the volcano Krakatoa.

filmography.title: Candles in the Dark
filmography.role_description: A KGB colonel in this drama set in Estonia, which Schell also directed.
filmography.plot: A young American girl visits her father in Soviet-occupied Estonia and gets involved in the struggle for freedom.

filmography.title: Left Luggage
filmography.role_description: The father of the main character, a Holocaust survivor who has buried his past.
filmography.plot: A liberal Jewish student in Antwerp takes a job as a nanny for a Hasidic family and learns to respect their traditions.
